phrase.item: Once upon a time, there was a wise man, he spread the knowledge of magic.
One day he left this world, he died.
The wise man's son stayed [in the village]. Some time passed and the people came to him and started to hit him and curse him, saying, "Your father didn't teach us the knowledge of magic.
Now whatever it is, you should teach us."
The boy said, "I don't know anything."
The people said, "We will show which way to go, and [how] to gain that knowledge."
The people said, "Go to the miracle, and he will teach you this knowledge".
Shortly, he went to the old miracle.
The old miracle said, "Hey young boy, do you have knowledge of magic?"
He replied, "No, my father was a mullah and he died.
Now these people are holding onto my collar, so that I should be a mullah.
I came to you so that you could teach me."
The old man said, "First, you should meet the angels Morut and Orut.
Otherwise, you won't be able to spread this knowledge.
I will take you to the Jabal mountain and the Bobul cave.
There will be forty stairs there.
When you step each stair, don't mention God's name."
The boy walked for a while and the sound of Nakir became louder.
Suddenly the boy got scared and called "Bismillahi Rahmani Rahim."
At that moment, the angels Orut and Morut became aware of it, they came and asked, "What do you want?"
The boy told them his whole story: "My father was a mullah, I am his son and serving after my father."
When my father was alive he didn't teach me."
Orut and Morut replied to him that, "It is time for us to reveal it.
Soon, we will go ourselves and spread it among the people. You, mullah's son, [are] free."
